intro: Erigeron turkestanicus, commonly known as the Turkestan fleabane, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has narrow, hairy leaves. Its flowers are usually pale blue or white, with a central yellow disk, and bloom during the summer months. It is often found in mountainous regions and is adapted to withstand arid conditions.
